p: There was significant difference ( P < 0.05) in IC 50 values between water and methanol extracts of S. pinnata (both strain), E. abyssinica, Z. chalybeum, and S. africana assayed against W2 strain of P. falciparum. Methanol extracts of S. pinnata (both strains) and E. abyssinica (W2) were observed to be more active than the aqueous while aqueous extracts of Z. chalybeum and S. africana assayed against W2 strain of P. falciparum were observed to be more active than the methanol extracts ( Table 2).
